column1: question
Provide a brief overview of the history of your company
Describe the products and/or services and capabilities provided by your company.

Describe any eligibility requirements for your solution including but not limited to diagnosis, race, color, national origin, sex, age or disability. Please provide the rationale to support the limitation, including but not limited to clinical support.

Have you worked with Independence Blue Cross Before or any other Blue Cross Blue Shield plans in the past? If yes, please provide a point of contact and a description of the services performed or products offered.
Is your company formally affiliated with Independence Blue Cross or any of its subsidiaries?  If so, please describe the relationship.

Is your company a certified diverse supplier?  If yes, please provide a copy of your certification from the certifying agency (e.g. WBENC - women-owned enterprise)? If you are not certified by a third party agency as a diverse supplier, do you have a formal supplier diversity program?  If yes, please explain.
Who are your primary customers?
Who are your primary competitors? How are you uniquely positioned?
Please describe your company’s strategy related to health plans/ payors.
test question/answer that should bring down th ematch rate intentionally
Summarize your company’s history, including founding year and major milestones.
What are your core products and services, and what business problems do they solve?
Do you have any member eligibility restrictions (e.g., diagnosis, age, disability)? Provide the clinical rationale.
List Blue plan references (including Independence Blue Cross if applicable) with contacts and a brief description of services delivered.
Are there any formal affiliations with Independence Blue Cross or its subsidiaries? Describe the relationship.
Are you a certified diverse supplier (e.g., WBENC)? If not, do you maintain a supplier diversity program?
Identify your primary customer segments.
Name your top competitors and explain your unique differentiators.
Outline your go-to-market strategy with health plans/payers.
Provide a current SOC 2 Type II or HITRUST certification summary.
